member.name: T:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort
member.remarks: Events are raised on a secondary thread when data is received. Because these events are raised on a secondary thread, and not the main thread, attempting to modify some elements in the main thread, such as UI elements, could raise a threading exception. If it is necessary to modify elements in the main Form or Control, post change requests back using Invoke (or BeginInvoke to avoid deadlock), which will do the work on the proper thread.

member.name: E:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.Connected
member.summary: Occures after the serial port is connected.

member.name: E:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.Disconnected
member.summary: Occures when the serial port is disconnected.

member.name: E:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.Faulted
member.summary: Occures when the serial port communication is faulted.
member.example: When you unplug an USB device which communicates on a virtual serial port.

member.name: E:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.LineStatusChanged
member.summary: Occures when the line status of the serial port is changed.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.Port
member.summary: Physical name of the serial port.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.BaudRate
member.summary: Baud rate at which the communications device operates.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.CustomBaudRate
member.summary: Custom baud rate value, used when BaudRate is set to Custom.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.StopBits
member.summary: Number of stop bits to be used.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.DataWidth
member.summary: Number of bits in the bytes transmitted and received.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.EnableDtrOnOpen
member.summary: Enable DTR when the port is opening. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.EnableRtsOnOpen
member.summary: Enable RTS when the port is opening. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.HardwareFlowControl
member.summary: Hardware flow control of the serial port.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SoftwareFlowControl
member.summary: Software flow control of the serial port.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.Interval
member.summary: Time interval between two receivings in milliseconds (frequency).

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.Delay
member.summary: Time interval between two receivings in milliseconds (frequency). Same as Interval.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.CustomPortName
member.summary: Custom port name can be used when Port is set to Custom. You can use any name, different from COMMxx.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.XonChar
member.summary: Value of the XON character for both transmission and reception (ASCII: 0 - 255). The default value is (char)17.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.XoffChar
member.summary: Value of the XOFF character for both transmission and reception (ASCII: 0 - 255). The default value is (char)19.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.XonLim
member.summary: Minimum number of bytes allowed in the input buffer before the XON character is sent. The default value is 0, which means InputBuffer div 4.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.XoffLim
member.summary: Maximum number of bytes allowed in the input buffer before the XOFF character is sent. The maximum number of bytes allowed is calculated by subtracting this value from the size, in bytes, of the input buffer. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ParityCheck
member.summary: If this property is true, parity checking is performed and parity errors are reported. This should not be confused with the Parity member, which controls the type of parity used in communications. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ReplaceParityErrors
member.summary: Specifies whether bytes received with parity errors are replaced with the character specified by the ErrorChar member. If this member is true and the ParityCheck member is true, replacement occurs. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.DiscardNulls
member.summary: Specifies whether null bytes are discarded. If this member is true, null bytes are discarded when received. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.DsrSensitivity
member.summary: Specifies whether the communications driver is sensitive to the state of the DSR signal. If this member is true, the driver ignores any bytes received, unless the DSR modem input line is high. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.TxContinueOnXoff
member.summary: Specifies whether transmission stops when the input buffer is full and the driver has transmitted the Xoff character. If this member is true, transmission continues after the Xoff character has been sent. If this member is false, transmission does not continue until the input buffer is within XonLim bytes of being empty and the driver has transmitted the Xon character. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ErrorChar
member.summary: Value of the character used to replace bytes received with a parity error (ASCII: 0 - 255). The default value is (char)0.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.EofChar
member.summary: Value of the character used to signal the end of data (ASCII: 0 - 255). The default value is (char)26.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.EvtChar
member.summary: Value of the character used to signal an event (ASCII: 0 - 255). The default value is (char)26.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.InputBuffer
member.summary: Recommended size of the device's internal input buffer, in bytes.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.OutputBuffer
member.summary: Recommended size of the device's internal output buffer, in bytes.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ReadIntervalTimeout
member.summary: Maximum time allowed to elapse between the arrival of two characters on the communications line, in milliseconds. During a ReadFile operation, the time period begins when the first character is received. If the interval between the arrival of any two characters exceeds this amount, the ReadFile operation is completed and any buffered data is returned. A value of zero indicates that interval time-outs are not used. A value of MAXDWORD, combined with zero values for both the ReadTotalTimeoutConstant and ReadTotalTimeoutMultiplier members, specifies that the read operation is to return immediately with the characters that have already been received, even if no characters have been received.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ReadTotalTimeoutMultiplier
member.summary: Multiplier used to calculate the total time-out period for read operations, in milliseconds. For each read operation, this value is multiplied by the requested number of bytes to be read.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ReadTotalTimeoutConstant
member.summary: Constant used to calculate the total time-out period for read operations, in milliseconds. For each read operation, this value is added to the product of the ReadTotalTimeoutMultiplier member and the requested number of bytes. A value of zero for both the ReadTotalTimeoutMultiplier and ReadTotalTimeoutConstant members indicates that total time-outs are not used for read operations.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.WriteTotalTimeoutMultiplier
member.summary: Multiplier used to calculate the total time-out period for write operations, in milliseconds. For each write operation, this value is multiplied by the number of bytes to be written.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.WriteTotalTimeoutConstant
member.summary: Constant used to calculate the total time-out period for write operations, in milliseconds. For each write operation, this value is added to the product of the WriteTotalTimeoutMultiplier member and the number of bytes to be written. A value of zero for both the WriteTotalTimeoutMultiplier and WriteTotalTimeoutConstant members indicates that total time-outs are not used for write operations.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.LineStatus
member.summary: Line status of the serial port.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ConnectedTo
member.summary: Returns the physical port where the component is connected to.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.IsReceiving
member.summary: This property is false when the component is receiving data from the port, otherwise is false. Use this property to check if the component is inside a receiving process.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.IsSending
member.summary: This property is true when the component is sending data to the port, otherwise is false. Use this property to check if the component is inside a sending process.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.NeedSynchronization
member.summary: Set this property to true for thread safety. The default value is false. Note: if you set it to true, you may experiment thread interblocking and lower speed.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.NewLine
member.summary: Gets or sets the value used to interpret the end of a call to the SendAsciiStringLine methods.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.MaxLineLength
member.summary: The maximum length of a line, when ReadStringLine or ReadStringUpToEndChars methods are used in synchronous mode (AutoReceive = false). If maximum length is reached, the methods return with empty string. If this value is 0, there is no maximum length. The default value is 1000.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.AutoReceive
member.summary: Set this property to true, if you want to receive the incoming data automatically in the OnReceived event. Otherwise you have to use ReadBuffer method to get the received data. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.MinCheckDisconnectedInterval
member.summary: The minimum time interval in milliseconds, for which the port availability is checked. For time critical usage it's recommended to set it to a higher value. Default value is 50.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.IsFaulted
member.summary: Indicates that the last connection was faulted.
member.example: When you unplug an USB device which communicates on a virtual serial port.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.IContainer)
member.param: The IContainer that contains the Component. The components in a container are tracked in a first-in, first-out list, which also defines the order of the components within the container. The last component added is the last component in the list.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: True if managed resources should also be disposed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.OnSent(ZylSoft.Serial.DataEventArgs)
member.param: A DataEventArgs that contains the event data.
member.remarks: Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. The OnSent method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class. Notes to Inheritors: When overriding OnSent in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's OnSent method so that registered delegates receive the event.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.OnReceived(ZylSoft.Serial.DataEventArgs)
member.param: A DataEventArgs that contains the event data.
member.remarks: Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. The OnReceived method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class. Notes to Inheritors: When overriding OnReceived in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's OnReceived method so that registered delegates receive the event.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.OnConnected(ZylSoft.Serial.ConnectionEventArgs)
member.param: A ConnectionEventArgs that contains the event data.
member.remarks: Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. The OnConnected method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class. Notes to Inheritors: When overriding OnConnected in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's OnConnected method so that registered delegates receive the event.

member.remarks: Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. The OnDisconnected method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class. Notes to Inheritors: When overriding OnDisconnected in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's OnDisconnected method so that registered delegates receive the event.

member.param: A ConnectionEventArgs that contains the event data.
member.remarks: Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. The OnFaulted method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class. Notes to Inheritors: When overriding OnFaulted in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's OnFaulted method so that registered delegates receive the event.

member.remarks: Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. The OnLineStatusChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class. Notes to Inheritors: When overriding OnLineStatusChanged in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's OnLineStatusChanged method so that registered delegates receive the event.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.Open
member.returns: true if succeeded.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.IsConnected
member.summary: Returns true if the serial port is connected.
member.returns: Connected = true; not connected = false;

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SetDcbState(System.IntPtr)
member.returns: true if succeeded.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SetBuffers(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.returns: True, if succeeded.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SetTimeouts(System.IntPtr)
member.returns: True, if succeeded.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ClearInputBuffer
member.returns: True, if succeeded.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ClearOutputBuffer
member.returns: True, if succeeded.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.GetLineStatus(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Returns CTS, DSR, RING and DCD (or alternately RLSD or CD) signals' status.
member.returns: The first 4 bits of the result contains CTS, DSR, RING and DCD (RLSD or CD) signals status.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.GetDcd
member.summary: Returns the state of DCD (Data Carrier Detect, or alternately Carrier Detect abbreviated as CD, or RLSD (receive-line-signal-detect) line.
member.returns: Returns the state of DCD line.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.GetDcd(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Returns the state of DCD (Data Carrier Detect, or alternately Carrier Detect abbreviated as CD, or RLSD (receive-line-signal-detect) line from lineStatus parameter.
member.param: Line status parameter. The first 4 bits of the result contains CTS, DSR, RING and DCD (RLSD or CD) signals' status.
member.returns: Returns the state of DCD line.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.GetCts
member.summary: Returns the state of CTS (clear-to-send) line.
member.returns: Returns the state of CTS line.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.GetCts(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Returns the state of CTS (clear-to-send) line from lineStatus parameter.
member.param: Line status parameter. The first 4 bits of the result contains CTS, DSR, RING and DCD (RLSD or CD) signals' status.
member.returns: Returns the state of CTS line.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.GetDsr
member.summary: Returns the state of DSR (data-set-ready) line.
member.returns: Returns the state of DSR line.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.GetDsr(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Returns the state of DSR (data-set-ready) line from lineStatus parameter.
member.param: Line status parameter. The first 4 bits of the result contains CTS, DSR, RING and DCD (RLSD or CD) signals' status.
member.returns: Returns the state of DSR line.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.GetRing
member.summary: Returns the state of RING line.
member.returns: Returns the state of RING line.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.GetRing(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Returns the state of RING line from lineStatus parameter.
member.param: Line status parameter. The first 4 bits of the result contains CTS, DSR, RING and DCD (RLSD or CD) signals' status.
member.returns: Returns the state of RING line.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SetBreak(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets break line. When value is true, suspends character transmission and places the transmission line in a break state. When value is false, restores character transmission and places the transmission line in a nonbreak state.
member.returns: true if succeeded.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SetDtr(System.Boolean)
member.returns: True, if succeeded.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SetRts(System.Boolean)
member.returns: True, if succeeded.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SetXonXoff(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets XOnXoff state. When value is true, causes transmission to act as if an XON character has been received. When value is false, Causes transmission to act as if an XOFF character has been received.
member.returns: True, if succeeded.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ReadBuffer
member.summary: Synchronously reads the received data from the serial port to a byte array. It works only if AutoReceive property is false. Otherwise returns null.
member.returns: Returns the current buffer of the serial port in a byte array and discards it. Returns null, if there is no data in the buffer.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ReadBufferToString
member.summary: Synchronously reads the received data from the serial port to string. It works only if AutoReceive property is false. Otherwise returns null.
member.returns: Returns the current buffer of the serial port in string and discards it.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ReadBufferToEnumerable
member.summary: Synchronously reads the received data from the serial port to a byte list. It works only if AutoReceive property is false. Otherwise returns null.
member.returns: Returns the current buffer of the serial port in string and discards it.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ReadByte
member.summary: Synchronously reads one byte from the serial port, if data available. It works only if AutoReceive property is false. Otherwise returns null.
member.returns: Returns one byte in a byte array from the available buffer and discards that byte. Returns null, if there is no data in the buffer or AutoReceive is true.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ReadChar
member.summary: Synchronously reads one character from the serial port. It works only if AutoReceive property is false. Otherwise returns empty string.
member.returns: Returns one character in a string from the available buffer and discards that char. Returns empty string, if there is no data in the buffer or AutoReceive is true.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ReadStringUpToEndChars(System.String)
member.summary: Reads the serial port up to the first occurence of endChars sequence. It works only if AutoReceive property is false.
member.returns: Returns the contents of the input buffer up to the first occurrence of a endChars sequence, but endChars are not included in the result.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ReadBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads numberOfBytes bytes from the serial port. It works only if AutoReceive property is false.
member.param: The number of bytes to read.
member.returns: Returns numberOfBytes bytes from the serial port and discard them.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ReadLine
member.summary: Reads the serial port up to the first occurence of NewLine sequence. It works only if AutoReceive property is false.
member.returns: Returns the contents of the input buffer up to the first occurrence of a NewLine, but NewLine is not included in the result.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.GetAvailableInputBufferSize
member.summary: Returns the size of the input buffer available to be read (bytes to read).
member.returns: Size of the available input buffer in bytes.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SendByteArray(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sends a byte array to the serial port.
member.param: The byte array to be sent.
member.returns: The count of sent bytes.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SendByteArrayOnNewThread(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sends a byte array to the serial port on a separate thread.
member.param: The byte array to be sent.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SendUnicodeString(System.String)
member.summary: Sends a UTF16 string to the serial port.
member.returns: The count of sent bytes.

member.summary: Sends a UTF8 string to the serial port.
member.returns: The count of sent bytes.

member.summary: Sends a UTF7 string to the serial port.
member.returns: The count of sent bytes.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SendUtf32String(System.String)
member.summary: Sends a UTF32 string to the serial port.
member.returns: The count of sent bytes.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SendAsciiString(System.String)
member.summary: Sends an ASCII string to the serial port.
member.returns: The count of sent bytes.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SendAsciiStringOnNewThread(System.String)
member.summary: Sends an ASCII string to the serial port on a separate thread.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SendAsciiStringLine(System.String)
member.summary: Sends an ASCII string and the NewLine value to the serial port.
member.returns: The count of sent bytes.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SendString(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Sends a string with the selected encoding to the serial port.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SendStringOnNewThread(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Sends a string with the selected encoding to the serial port on a separate thread.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.SendByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Sends a byte to the serial port.
member.returns: The count of sent bytes.

member.returns: The equivalent SerialCommPort value.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.ProcessCommRegistryBugPriorFw4(System.String)
member.summary: Corrects a bug prior .net framework 4. (2.0, 3.5). Sometimes for bluetooth serial ports it reads from the registry COM32r, instead of COM32 or something similar.
member.param: Name of the port read from the registry.
member.returns: Cuts all the non-digit characters after the "COM" string.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialPort.GetExistingCommPorts
member.summary: Returns the existing serial ports of the system.

member.name: T:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialBaudRate
member.summary: Baud rate enumeration type. It's the measure of how fast data is moving between instruments that use serial communication. RS-232 uses only two voltage states, called MARK and SPACE. In such a two-state coding scheme, the baud rate is identical to the maximum number of bits of information, including "control" bits, that are transmitted per second.

member.name: T:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialStopBits
member.summary: Stop bits enumeration type. The last part of a character frame consists of 1, 1.5, or 2 stop bits. These bits are always represented by a negative voltage. If no further characters are transmitted, the line stays in the negative (MARK) condition. The transmission of the next character frame, if any, is heralded by a start bit of positive (SPACE) voltage.

member.name: T:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialDataWidth
member.summary: Data bits enumeration type (ByteSize). Data bits are transmitted "upside down and backwards." Inverted logic is used and the order of transmission is from least significant bit (LSB) to most significant bit (MSB). To interpret the data bits in a character frame, you must read from right to left, and read 1 for negative voltage and 0 for positive voltage.

member.name: T:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialParityBits
member.summary: Parity bits enumeration type. An optional parity bit follows the data bits in the character frame. The parity bit, if present, also follows inverted logic: read 1 for negative voltage and 0 for positive voltage. This bit is included as a simple means of error checking. The idea is this: you specify ahead of time whether the parity of the transmission is to be even or odd. Suppose the parity is chosen to be odd. The transmitter will then set the parity bit in such a way as to make an odd number of 1's among the data bits and the parity bit.

member.name: T:ZylSoft.Serial.SerialHardwareFlowControl
member.remarks: Possible values: None, None + RTS always on, RTS/CTS.

member.name: T:ZylSoft.Serial.ConnectionEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the Connected and Disconnected events.
member.remarks: The Connected event occurs when a connection was established. The Disconnected event occurs when the connection is closed. A ConnectionEventArgs specifies the related physical serial port.

member.name: T:ZylSoft.Serial.DataEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the Sent and Received events.
member.remarks: The Received event occurs when data was received. The Sent event occurs when data was sent. A DataEventArgs specifies the sent or received data.

member.name: T:ZylSoft.Serial.LineStatusEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the LineStatusChanged events.
member.remarks: The LineStatusChanged event occurs when the line status is changed. A LineStatusEventArgs specifies the new line status of the serial port.

member.name: P:ZylSoft.Serial.LineStatusEventArgs.LineStatus
member.summary: Line status of the serial port.

member.name: M:ZylSoft.Serial.LineStatusEventArgs.#ctor(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Line status of the serial port.

member.name: F:ZylSoft.Serial.NativeMethods.PurgeFlags.PurgeRxAbort
